Reviews.Title: “Clean, Basic Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: R T
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 night stay at the Al Viminale Hill Inn & Hotel. Pros: - Our room was a decent size and very clean with a nice bathroom. - The hotel is within easy walking distance (15 minutes) to most major tourist attractions (Colosseum, Spanish Steps, museums, etc.). - Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. - The price was lower than many other hotels we looked at and overall a very good value. Cons: - The hotel charges you for basic extras such as internet access (which we couldn't figure out how to connect to even with paying) and storing bags on checkout day (3 euro to store a bag in the corner of an upstairs bathroom) - The hotel's front desk/office was closed and staff was not around several times when we had questions (mostly late in the evening). - The hotel's location (near the Termini bus station) is not the most elegant in Rome. Conclusion: - Overall a nice, clean hotel in a good location for the tourist who wants to see all that Rome has to offer. A good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: JFisher744
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful with a great view. The receptionist was very helpful and friendly. It was a pleasure to come back to everynight after long days of touring the city. The bed was very comfortable and the room was bright and modern. Sound barriers between rooms are not great but that is common in Italy. Hot water is not unlimited but the shower was really cool. Close to Roma Termini and walking distance to a lot of sights and/or a metro station. The building has great character and we really enjoyed our 4 nights here!

Reviews.Title: “A Brilliant Charming Hotel, Good Location, Couldn't Of Asked For More!!!”
Reviews.Author: Simon050184
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for my girlfriend’s birthday, along with 7 others as part of a big group. We booked 5 rooms in total (4 double rooms and 1 room with 2 single beds). I asked for a view of the opera house (prior to our arrival at the hotel when we originally booked online through the hotel website) and got exactly that in the 4 double rooms. You get to soak in all the atmosphere of Rome that way and see everyone going about there day to day routine whilst you’re chilling out in your room!). The room with the 2 single beds was positioned towards the other side of the hotel which faced out towards a small courtyard with sun shining down on it majority of the day, so this didn't have a view of the opera house but the reception guy did say this as he gave the key cards for our rooms to us which we were all fine with anyway. Little tip for you, if it’s available at the time of your booking – ask for room 109. This is the room me and my girlfriend stayed in. Large spacious room with a big king side bed, It has his and hers sinks in the bathroom (compared to some rooms which just have the 1 sink) and there is also a TV cleverly built into the mirror at the touch of a button! … (I was amazed at this!!) Also, an lovely view of the opera house The hotel has a very charming authentic feel to it as soon as you walk up and into it. It has a quirky walkway leading up to the small reception which is tastefully decorated to suit the history of Rome. To the left and right of the main reception, they have 2 authentic very old lifts which adds charm and character to the ambience of the hotel (they are quiet and can accommodate a maximum 3 people with luggage at a time or 4 people without luggage!). In between these lifts is the small reception area, were you can also buy bottles of water and pick up free maps / tourists guides and info etc (which is quite handy). I think the reception closes about 9 or 10pm …. Something like that anyway! I’ve noticed some reviews people have put on here saying that taxi drivers etc have difficulty finding the hotel?? I don’t know how as all you have to say is ‘Opposite the opera house on Al Viminale Street) and they know exactly were you mean. The hotel has a brass sign outside it which clearly says the hotel name anyway. I think this hotel deserves more than a 3 star status to be quite honest. It’s in a brilliant location (5 minute walk from underground station AND the bus station next to it) across the road from a supermarket and a couple of delicatessens and about a 20 minute walk from the coliseum. ---------------------------------------------------------------- Moving off the topic of the hotel slightly, if you’re going to be staying here, then im guessing you will want to know the nearest supermarket and delicatessens etc Literally a stone throw from the hotel to the left of the opera house (as you come out of the big door at the entrance) there is a big supermarket and 1 or 2 delicatessens. The supermarket itself is not exactly signed / illuminated so its easy to miss….so much so I dint even know it was there myself until I walked into it and looked down the steps! If you like your lager, you can pick up a 660ml bottle of Peroni in there for 40 cence !!! which is about 30 / 40p in English money ! I know Peroni is Italian made but I’ve never seen lager this cheap before and no it wasn’t a price error lol !! There is a lovely delicatessen about 3 or 4 doors down from the hotel …. (again, as you turn left out of the hotel) which serve gorgeous fresh pastries, croissants and Panini’s etc. Back onto the topic of the hotel again - fantastic and ticked all the boxed for us. We liked it that much, we plan to stay there again for our next trip to rome. When ever I get chance, I’ll try an upload a photo of the room, bathroom and panoramic picture of the view looking out from the room! All 9 of us though this hotel was an absolute gem of a find, and I’m sure you’ll have the same view once you’ve stayed there yourself. :0)

Reviews.Title: “A treat in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Scottishwombat
Reviews.Content: For those that have not stayed in Italian hotels, the view of the hotel from the street is a little daunting. Just a small sign and big door. However inside the small reception office has a cheery and helpful receptionist with good English ( but will let you stumble through your italian if you want to try it out!). The room was excellent. Comfortable big bed, modern functioning bathroom and a very nice view out to the opera. Ideal location for early morning trip to Termini station. Very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: petros p Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the staff were great from recepion down to cleaning staff i will be comeing back the hotel was close to all the sights there is a great metro that takes minuits to get you were you need to go most are in walking distance just avpid taxi they over charge. 20 euros for 700 meters you can walk that in 5 mins Petros Petrou

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault it”
Reviews.Author: Gill1972
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay, could not fault the accommodation at all. Close to Termini Station and the Metro and in walking distance of all the main tourist attractions. The room itself was of a good standard with a lovely view out towards the opera house. Towels were changed daily throughout our stay, staff are very helpful especially the guy on reception who took time to explain to us the best ways to reach each of the main attractions. No complaints whatsoever about this accommodation. Would not hesitate to recommend to fellow travellers looking for a good base to explore the fantastic City of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amazing shower!”
Reviews.Author: Roslyn E
Reviews.Content: This is a great value hotel in terms of its location and amenities. In the March off season, prices were about 130 USD, which was a little high for my budget, but was certainly worth it. Its an easy 7 min walk to the train station and only 20 min walk to all things classic Rome. The real sell for this hotel is its shower and location. It may seem silly to pick a hotel based on the shower, but it really a thing of luxury. Everything was very clean and the staff was very friendly. The free pizza offer is an okay pizza but you'll get a pushy waiter so be prepared. There isn't breakfast which isn't quite such a downside since the European included breakfasts that I saw on my trip weren't much to begin with. All around though, good hotel and would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Central and good value”
Reviews.Author: tritone1960
Reviews.Content: Its location is within easy reach of the main sights in Rome (which is well served with an efficient public transport system). The rooms have been recently refurbished to a high standard and everything is new including a fancy shower! The only downside for rooms overlooking the via del Viminale is that it can be a bit noisy at times but all told, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Jill T
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for two nights a couple of days ago. Honestly a great location and the best value! It was very modern with clean decor and the bathroom looked great. The rooms were a little small but in my experience all hotel rooms in Europe are smaller that the average American hotel. Our double room also had a sofa which was nice to just sit on instead of the bed. The guy at the front desk was very nice and very helpful. Do book through their website cause they throw in a bunch of freebies like wifi and luggage storage. Definitely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Scot M
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel for a tourist who wants to explore Rome. The hotel's location is within a 10-15 minute walk to the Coliseum and Ancient Rome and about 15-20 min walk to the Pantheon, which really isnt bad when there is so much to look at while walking around. Also, its only a 5 minute walk from Rome Termini station (the main train/bus station in Rome which is where you will arrive from the airport if you take the train or the Terravision/Sitbus shuttle bus) so its a centric location thats a perfect for anyone who loves to walk around cities. The hotel itself is old, but in a good way, especially the 1930's era elevator. The rooms themselves were renovated in the last couple of years and are just fine, especially the new showers which are very cool (multiple heads, cool mood lighting, etc). Also, for a 3-star hotel its a great value and very affordable for a Rome hotel in that location. When I go back to Rome I will stay at this hotel again because you cannot beat the price with that location.

Reviews.Title: “cozy & good to get back to after a long day of site-seeing”
Reviews.Author: natalie m
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very comfterball location - next to termini train station (40 minutes from the airpoert & 15 minutes of walking to the hotel) and close to the metro station at republica Square. Receptionist is very nice & welcoming - gives you a free map & explains about all the nearest sites. The hotel has an antic 100 years old elevator made out of wood - don't be afraid to use it, it's old but strong & gives a nice touch to the apartment building hotel. The rooms aren't very big but fits just right to a couple that plans a 3-5 days vacation in rome. great led "LG" 42 inch tv with some disturbed channels! comfortable king-size bed, beautiful wall painting & chandelier! the great part is the bathroom, two sinks that are clear, a mirror with tv built in it (very cool) & a 6 tap Massage shower with a built in lighting which color you can change by a touch button according to your mode at the certain moment. There's a coffee corner at every floor. The walls are a bit thin so you can be heard threw the wall. clean, nice & recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Location was the best quality of hotel,”
Reviews.Author: South84
Reviews.Content: We were surprised how easy we found the place having read lots of reviews before going about there not being enough signs for the hotel, but apart from when we checked in we never saw any staff,& even the day we did check in we were waiting in lobby area for 15mins before we met anyone who worked there so we disagree with all the reviews of staff being helpful, because we didn't see them at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Average & Sewer Smell”
Reviews.Author: cahayapagi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in Jan '12. The room we booked was decent, small in size, not much space to move around especially with 2 huge suitcases. Our room was facing opera house. We don't really recommend this room because of the street noise (cars, honks, etc). The room also has very thin wall, we could heard other guests discussion from next door. Refreshment (coffee, tea, glasses, cups) facilities are shared with other guests in the pantry. They have interesting looking shower but the pressure was very poor. The sewer smell was very strong from our bathroom. Every time the cleaner came they had to leave the window open. They had an antique lift which is definitely a nice touch. Friendly staff. Nice flat screen TV but don't waste your time in front of the TV if you are in Rome. Location is good, near to attractions & Termini. Restaurants are plenty within walking distant. Rome is a beautiful city. This is definitely not our last visit, but next visit will be in different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “young couple”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really central location but difficult to find if unfamilar with the area, room was lovely, very clean and so was bathroom, staff very helpful and friendly and provide all services a person would need but the rooms aren't sound-proof as you can hear other guests in the halls and lobbies but i would recommend this hotel to couples of any age; brilliant stay and we'd definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: KT L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: just renovated. very new and clean. great location to train station. good idea with the free pizza - the restaurant was alright and with good and honest service. friendly staff. we visited during one of the coldest week in Rome, but hotel was very warm and we had a v good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: ihbScotland
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent - 5 minutes to Terminale, and 3 minutes to Republica metro, and the same to buses along the Via Nazionale. Around are numerous cafés for coffee, croissants and excellent sandwiches. We tried two local restaurants which were acceptable, but this is a tourist area so it does not have the best food. There is a daily market round the corner which has an excellent fruit stall, and a small supermarket in a basement opposite. So you won't starve around here! There is no hotel lobby, only a small office which is staffed as required: not a problem because we emailed ahead telling them we would arrive after 2200, and someone was waiting for us. There are facilities to make hot drinks and a very small area to sit for a coffee, breakfast etc. So one person nips out to buy the cornetti whilst the other makes the coffee or tea. Entrance to the building and room is by electronic keycard. The room was compact. That said it was very clean (and the cleaning staff do a good job), quiet when the window is closed, and has the snazziest shower ever with multicoloured lights and a variety of spray nozzles. Fun! Wifi costs, but is reasonable. There is a room to store luggage when you check out. The lift is an antique, but it works. If you want a no frills, keenly priced, centrally located hotel in Rome, this may be for you.

Reviews.Title: “really nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: mauromacaroni
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Al Viminale Street Deluxe Inn for 3 nights and I can say we really enjoyed it. The room was small but very clean, location was excellent and the building and the elevator old but fabulous. Plus the guys at the reception were really helpful. Don't go anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Manon R
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, situated in a quiet street next to the station. The hotel is a bit hard to find, but the building is really nice, and the staff is very welcoming and helpful. There is an old elevator that gives the hotel a lot of charm. We had a room with view on the theater as requested, the room was very clean, including the bathroom. There's a small kitchen outside the room, where you can prepare some coffee and tea, this is much appreciated in the morning. The only thing is that from time to time we could hear the noise from the room next door. All the Roman monuments are accessible walking. We had a very good stay in this hotel and we would definitely go back al Viminale if travelling to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “nice and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: jhun mark l
Reviews.Content: After hours of flight, it was very relaxing being welcomed by the staff. Marco was one of those staff who helped us during our stay, showing us where to go and giving some useful informations. Very kind and polite. The hotel is sited not too far from the central terminal station. It is also surrounded by lots of coffee shops and restaurants. There is also a supermarket near the hotel. Tourist's spots are just a walking distance from the hotel. The hotel is clean and very quite. Rooms have noise-proofed windows that you can't even hear the noise from the street. Breakfast was not included but there was a bar area where i can make coffee and tea whenever i want just for free and that was great!!. Nice modern hotel with modern facilities inside such us electronic safe, mini frigo bar, large HD tv, Dvd player, and the most interesting is the jacuzzi shower with chromotherapy and hydro massage thing:) i liked it.!! I will surely come back for a stay in this hotel and recommend to my friends...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: k n
Reviews.Content: Just after renovation. Very clean rooms (and I am very sensitive to smell). Staff - friendly. Good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: MHas25
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the location of this hotel is phenomenal- not too close to termini station and close enough to all the major attractions. Emiliano at reception is fantastic and worth his weight in gold, he helped with how to use transport, what attractions to see and when and even the names of local restaurants he suggested were brilliant. The hotel itself is a modern 200yr old building- I say modern because all of the rooms have been renovated. After having stayed at a number of hotels all over Italy this one by far is the most comfortable, clean and spacious and the bathroom was extroadinarily big in comparison to other hotels. I stayed here in October and returned in November and will definately be returning here on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthAustraliaAussie
Reviews.Content: The warm welcome from Marco at reception was just the start. Once we were taken to the room in a beautiful olden style lift (took a photo) we were more that pleasantly surprised. Beautiful, clean, spacious and newly decorated room. The bathroom was lovely with a tv in the mirror! Never seen that before. There is a share kitchen where we could make an unlimited number of coffee's or tea's. We found the location excellent. Close to the train station, not too far to two metro stations and one street from all the bus services.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: ozanarsoy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very close to Termini. You have to walk 1,5-2 km to city centre or you can go by bus. The room standard was good. Small room but well designed. It was very clean. Only problem with hotel was fridge. It was working only when you are in room. The electricity of fridge is connected to card system. The staff was nice and friendly.It was good choice

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: eladousa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights, and although we had a bit of a hard time finding it (it's in a rather unmarked door & then once you find the outside door, there isn't any signage for the office door) but once we got there and were shown to our room, it was magnificent! The room was very large and we had a great view of the Opera House. Nicely located a few minutes walk from the train station and fairly central to get to everything. Nice cafes right around the area to walk to, as well as a wine store. LOVED that they had extra blankets and pillows already in the room as we found that we just do not like European pillows at ALL!!

Reviews.Title: “The Al Viminale at no. 38 Via del Viminale - excellent and central -”
Reviews.Author: alainwelch
Reviews.Content: Mio soggiorno Al 38 Viminale Strret Deluce Inn la settimana scorsa ( 28 sett > 1° ott ) - eccellente - excellent . This established has a great position since it is about 10 minutes to the Termini Railway Station ... it nearly takes longer to walk from the station entrance to the Leonardo Express Fiumicino Airport platform than to get to them . Its situation is very pleasant since it is virtually opposite the front of the Teatro dell' Opera , which has nicely planted garden borders in front . The entrance to the impressive building is by a very high , big double " gate -door " . Ring on the Inn's door bell which is on the right hand side of the main doors .Proceed along a wide , airy and light entrance hall and their office is to the right ( the building , which has private apartments too - also has their concierge's office to the left. The lift , which is historic and functions very well , will take you to your floor - the Inn has a unti of about five rooms on the first , third and fifth floors. The key system works for the main entrance as well as the entrance door to the floor unit of five /four rooms and then of course for your room . Parquet floors and an impeccable bedroom greeted me .. the room was very airy and light , and nicely decorated with taste. Cupboard /wardrobe space was ample ( for me ) and one housed an individual safe, which worked excellently and simply . The air conditioning did too - when you extract the key as you go outside from the electrical card recipient at the entrance to the room , the entire electrical system is put off . The shower room was very good and the shower sophisticated. The towels were really very good and the maid service efficient. The soap , gel and shower are in the drawer underneath the attractive very thick glass lavabo . I was on the third floor and found that it was not noisy , pleasantly so . Of course , there is some background noise - in a capital city bang in the middle of it , this is normal . The view of the Opera House is great . Nearby , just two doors down going out on your left , there is caffé - small modern style restaurant called "Il Palchetto " - their morning Viennoiserie/pastries are cooked on site and delicious . Espresso coffee is just 80 centimes and the place is used a lot by locals . The frontage is quite small , about 3 meters.. but do go in . I also ate a late supper there , which was nicely presented and very tasty . The staff her as in the Inn , are all very courteous . . On the corner of Via Napoli and Vai del Viminale - a few yards further down on the left as you come out of the CafféPalchetto /Inn , there is a very discreetly indicated small food supermarket , called Carréfour Express - great for buying some bottled drinks , food and fruit . It looks strange , but one has to take a lift to the basement level where the shop is! If you carry on down the Via Napoli , you will find an Internet Point at no . 26 on the left hand side. They open I think at 9a.m. and close at midnight . Not over big , but they are used to the tourist market and visitors from all over the planet . They also do Box Office bookings for concerts , national and international phoning , fax , photocopying ,etc.. Also further down the Via del Viminale, again on the left coming out of the Inn , there is a chemist on the corner with Via Agostino de Pretis - about 250 meters/yards I estimate . One of the nearest Metro stops is Repubblica and there is of course a Metro at the Termini . I also ate at the " Cotto" in Via Torino - which is about 250 meters along after the Opera House - indoor and outdoor lunching and dining . Very good too . I plan on returning to the Inn in November and am booking for several dates in 2012 - what more can I say . Oh , I'm forgetting .. :) ... the bed linen is fine and the bed comfortable. I had a good night's sleep ( three nights this time ) . Vivia Roma . Alan K.

Reviews.Title: “As good as they say! stay here if you want value and good location!”
Reviews.Author: waynelim
Reviews.Content: Also know as 38 Viminale, I found this hotel to be as good as everyone's review. Good value, location and excellent service. I don't want to repeat all the good reviews but I would like to say: 1. The person who managed the front desk, Mark was a excellent host. He was informative, patient, helpful and was truly above the customer service we experienced in Rome. 2. There is a little cafe around the corner on Via Napoli that has excellent breakfast items. My wife and I would go there each morning and have warm panini, pastry, various cafe and fresh OJ amd never more then E5.00- E7.00 together. 3. Buy the Roma pass if you are getting around by bus and metro, not only is it good value you get to skip the long lines so common at the first two sites you choose. I would use for Colosseum. 4. Visit Trastevere, a nice local town like area away from the endless crowds of Ancient Rome. This area has a nice local feel, makes a good stroll, and is full of well priced and excellent eateries and bars, not like the overpriced, tourist catering areas near the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great home away from home”
Reviews.Author: travelgurl712
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. The Inn provided pretty much everything that we needed, except wi-fi. The room was clean and comfortable and there was a common area that was useful (hot water, coffee, glasses, utensils). There is a market around the corner if you want to get snacks (bottled water, fruit, etc.) We found the location very convenient: close to Termini Station to catch the metro and tour buses. If you are up for it, we walked all the way from the Vatican one day (at a leisurely pace of course with lotsa stops to take photos, admire the buildings, to have lunch and gelato, etc.). The other reviews are correct in that it is in a building that has offices and the set-up was not your typical hotel. We kinda of liked staying at a place that felt like you were living in Rome in your own little apartment. Some cons: first day we had no hot water, that was fixed the next day. The elevator is really cool but sometimes did not run smoothly. Then you would have to walk up or down five flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden hotel in the apartment building!”
Reviews.Author: 8achan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close from the Termini Station. We stayed here for a night, and we had some difficulty finding this hotel. There is no hotel sign because it is an apartment building with big gated doors right across from the Opera Theatre. We were well taken care of at a check in counter, but the front desk is only open from 8 am to 5 pm. The room was very clean and small, and had a fancy TV, sink and shower that has different colour therapy and jet streams. I also was able to leave the luggage for the day for 3 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: zilbeth2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in June 2011. Small hotel, but room was renovated & modern. Very clean. Shower is in the main part of the hotel room (like a capsule-type thing), sort of weird, but didn't bother us much. Guy who works the "front desk" downstairs was very nice & helpful. One downside was no breakfast included & you have to pay for internet (although it wasn't expensive). Overall, we were happy with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Different, But Nice Play to Stay”
Reviews.Author: lchjr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this little boutique hotel for three nights, and had a good overall experience. The hotel is a couple of floors in an apartment building. Our room was contemporary and elegant looking. It had a comfortable king bed, nice sofa and a good view right across the street to the classic-looking Opera Theater. There's a big flat screen TV, and the small bathroom had a shower with multiple jets which my wife really loved. The ultra contemporary bathroom sink was a little strange---there was no stopper, so you couldn't fiil it up for shaving. One thing we liked was that there's good light in the room. The staff are friendly, but are generally only there during the day (but are reachable by telephone if any major issues during the night). There's no breakfast, so you have to go out to one of the many cafes in the area, or you could eat in your room, as there is a good coffee machine near every room and a refrigerator in the room. Security is good, as access is restricted for much of the day (and all night)---you have to use your key card to get in. The hotel is only 5 minutes from the Termini Station. Although this is not an area where you'll find some of Rome's finest restaurants, there are many decent places to eat within a short walk from the hotel. We found Viminale Street to be reasonably quiet, so you don't get much street noise in your room. And the hotel is a good value---for what you get here, you'd probably pay a lot more in other Rome hotels..

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room and location”
Reviews.Author: osirees
Reviews.Content: Loved the location. Its 5 mins from Roma Termini. The problem with Rome is that there are only 2 metro lines, one that goes towards Colosseum and another towards Vatican. So this location is perfect. You get trains to go to the Airport also. The building might look little rusty but that's not something to worry about in a city where everything is at least 500 yrs old. The room was excellent and with modern furnishing. My room also had aqua jet shower. The reason I did not give 5 stars is because it does not have free WIFI. It cost 3 EUR for an hour of use. I was expecting a free WIFI because I did not do my research before hand. But that's my fault, so if you don't need WIFI then you can ignore this. The second reason is that the reception is not attended 24hrs. There attendant is at the reception from morning 8 to evening 7 and even during day time they are not always there. Its not like you need someone all the time but for me its good to know that if I need something there will be someone available. All thing considered nothing can beat the location. But at the same time if you are looking for a quiet "Roman" alley kind of experience then may be you should look somewhere close to Pantheon. Since its close to Roma Termini the streets are normally crowded and vehicles are parked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: Mirene-Mirene
Reviews.Content: I spent here only one night but it was enough to enjoy the comfort of the Al Viminale Street Deluxe Inn. LOCATION: Close to Roma Termini (Central railway station of Rome), but not too much - you don’t feel that you’re in the middle of crowds and constant rush. The building where the Deluxe Inn is located (it occupies the 3rd and the 5th floor, as far as I understood) is just opposite the Opera House – so I really advise all opera fans to ask for a room with a view (preferably on the 5th floor) – the façade of the Opera will be seen from your window, and it’s really beautiful! If you plan to travel a lot from Termini, it’s also a good choice. SURROUNDING AREA. In general, the traffic in the surrounding area is rather active, but Piazza Beniamino Gigli which the Inn faces is much calmer and the windows are so good that you won’t hear a thing. Though the area closer to Termini is not that quiet, near the Inn you feel absolutely secure. ROOM. I had Room 503 with two windows and a great view of the Opera, a comfy double bed, efficient a/c, a safe, an enormous TV and a fridge. The room was well-decorated and clean. It’s really pleasant for a solo traveler. But if you have a partner I’d recommend to ask for another room as in this one you can’t have enough privacy in the bathroom/toilet but I suppose it’s the only room arranged like that. FACILITIES. The Deluxe Inn normally doesn’t serve breakfast, but there’s a kitchen corner where you can boil water, get tea/coffee for free, take cutlery, cups and glasses. You can find a lot of shops and cafes nearby, so you won’t be hungry. If you need to store you luggage after check-out, you can lock it in a special room. All in all, I was really happy with the Deluxe Inn. It’s good value for money and I’d return here– especially if I went to Rome with the purpose of going to the Opera or traveling a lot in the neighbourhood of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: HollowVictory
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2011 and totally loved this hotel. Short easy walk from Termini Station - maybe 2 or 3 blocks - which was very convenient for us. Just across from the opera theatre but be beware, this is not some large scale hotel with a big sign - it's just a massive brown or black door and the number 38 might be hard to spot. When the hotel sends you an email asking to advise what time you will be there, that's because someone will be waiting for you to let you in. Our initial impression was oh dear, must be a one room hotel but not to worry - I think it takes up the whole 3rd floor. Reception on the ground floor is tiny but this is no indication at all. Our room - 309 - was absolutely gorgeous and totally quiet at night. Shower had all the bells and whistles, can even make the lights go purple and green if you want! TV is huge. Bed ultra comfy. Also has sink and wee desk by the window. Everything is super clean. Suppose the only downside is by American standards, the room might be small but get over it - you are in Europe and when in Rome... Voucher for coffee at the cafe downstairs and the coffee was lovely! And staff was very nice too. Will def go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite decent, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Oiler99
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were happy with everything at this hotel. Many of the reviews below highlight the strengths (location, cleanliness, decor, amenities, security). I found the bed to be too firm (though this seemed to be a theme throughout Europe). Also enjoyed the high-tech shower, though it seemed to take forever to get water warm enough to shower with in the evenings. Also, the drain filled up quickly in the shower, to the point where we had to take off the strange metal cover to it, which only partially helped. This limited our ability to take full advantage of the water jets, as turning them on full force would result in standing in your own filth. To the hotel's credit, we never complained about this to give them a chance to correct it. Otherwise, we were happy to stay here and would certainly return. The archaic lift and stairwells actually adds great character to the building as well. Free wi-fi would be nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, comfortable room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Eire27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 3 night weekend city break, had read a lot of reviews and finally decided to stay here. Is in a beautiful old building but rooms feel modern with bathrooms very modern indeed. Rooms cleaned daily, towels replaced, tea making facilities available, large tv, very few channels though. Bthroom VERY small but immaculate. There was a hob and sink in the room but no utensils. Excellent black out blinds also and good air con. Reception staff excellent, very very helpful, were charged for late check in, could leave our luggage after check out at 10.30 for no charge. Check out is early 10.30 not 11 til 12 as booking website suggested. No bar/restaurant/vending machines, but lots of local bars/cafes near by. 5 minute walk from termini/ republicca stations. Hotel felt secure, is a safe in the rooms. I would stay here again, and it is a lot cheaper than cimilar hotels and to a better standard. is a long walk to say Trevi fountain (hills) but if you have time would take 20-30 minutes by time read maps!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LauraBart
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good bed, good view, everything on walking distance, nice staff', good price. There's no breakfast, but we went every morning out for breakfast (free cappuccino by showing your room key of the hotel), sat and ate our panini's on the piazza a few meters further around a beautiful fountain, very satisfying and a good start for every day finding where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: katrob
Reviews.Content: Great hotel!! Room, location, staff.....everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel & great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Barbra08
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Our host was very helpful, professional and spoke really good english. We received a pocket map of rome upon arrival which was very helpful and we used it thoughout our stay. Good location, very secure and close to the Termini train station and walkng distance to all major attractions. Plenty of restaurants and cafes in the neighbourhood. Clean, good size room with big TV, modern bathroom wtih great jacuzzi shower. Coffee/tea making facility available in the hallway. The hotel has a small luggage store which was an added bonus as our return flight was late in the evening and for a small fee we were able to leave our suitcases after check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Mille grazzi!! Fantastico!!”
Reviews.Author: Bleeker76
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here. Rooms are fantastic , location superb! I travel a lot for business and stay mostly at 4 and 5 star hotels and the viminale inn's luxury rooms can rival any. Many thanks to emiliano a proud 5th generation roman who is the best host one could wish. My wife still talks about him in her sleep. Not sure if that's good or not. :-) just kidding of course! Cleaning lady looks like a model and all are super friendly. Will defiantly go here again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel we've been looking for!”
Reviews.Author: al6281
Reviews.Content: My wife and i take a lot of city breaks and usually look for "budget" accommodation as we spend most of our time out and about. With this in mind we've expected some of the places we've stayed to have flaws, maybe not the cleanest, maybe a bit noisy, cold, warm, tacky, dodgy neighbourhood etc. At the Al Viminale Street Deluxe Inn you get none of the above. We were greeted by a friendly welcome and shown to our room which was spotless, more than big enough and tastefully decorated. The room had a large flat screen TV, fridge, multi jet shower and even a TV in the bathroom! The bed was comfortable and spotlessley clean and towels were changed daily. Just outside the room there was a small kitchen where we could make tea and coffee etc. There are several cafe's and small retaurants very close to the hotel and the fact that breakfast isn't included really isn't a problem. It took us less than 5 minutes to find the hotel from Termini station and walking to the Collosseum or Trevi fountain should take about 10 mins. I would say this accommodation isn't so much a "hotel" as it is a group of "small apartments" which i found perfectly suited us. I'd would wholehartedly recommend this accomodation to anyone and will definitely use it again!

Reviews.Title: “Best location! Quality rooms! Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: dragosvc
Reviews.Content: As I said in my title: Best location! Quality rooms! Friendly staff! Everything was just as I expected from the booking.com and information received from web site. There are only 2 things I recommend: 1. possibility for breakfast to be included in room price, because there are a lot of small restaurants in the area 2. free internet in the hotel or just an area Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: BigAndri
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights there, this was the most amazing, surprising find!!! Spotless and luxury....the best shower ever...i've stayed in all kinds of hotels in Rome, and Al Viminale Street De Luxe Inn has by far been my favorite! The Staff was nice and polite, speak very good english, the picked us up at the airport, warm welcoming and Free Pizza offered. Great value for money and very secure, all in all very recommended!

Reviews.Title: “We are very satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: gertenhong
Reviews.Content: Outside our room there was a mini-bar. There we eat our breakfast and there is a watercooker and other supplies. You can rent DVD at the hotel office.My wife watch every day "Holliday in Rome".Close to the hotel there is a small bar and restaraunt with nice employees and delicious food.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, clean with great location.”
Reviews.Author: KDistel13
Reviews.Content: We toured Italy for our honeymoon and the first stop was in Rome. We stayed here for 4 days and 3 nights. The hotel is within walking distance to the Colosseum, Ancient City, their subway system and many good restaurants and bars. The rooms were very cute and clean. There was a small refrigerator in the room, and a joint kitchenette that was shared by all of the hotel rooms. The staff there was also very helpful when it came to travel information and meal recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara60763
Reviews.Content: It was really a treat to stay at this beautiful hotel. Our host, Emilio, was very helpful and accommodating. We loved our room - large and airy with a window that looked out onto the street below. One of the surprises this hotel had was a heating elelment for the towels in the bathroom. There is nothing nicer than warm towels after a shower. By the way, the bathroom was sleek and modern. There was plenty of closet space and shelves for all our clothes. We will stay here again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, very nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: CapitanaD
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Viminale Inn for 4 days in September. Room 306 was very clean, well lit and had a view of the opera house across the street. Furnishings were very stylish and in excellent condition. This room sleeps three (king and twin bed), had a desk, tv, dvd player, and very modern bathroom with a towel warmer and great jacuzzi shower. Booking in advance online saves money, and they offer a free pizza at a nearby restaurant as part of the deal. The hotel is well located, close to the train station (Termini) and Piazza della Repubblica, great for getting the metro and tour buses, but is also easy walking distance to most monuments. I will most certainly choose this hotel again on future trips to Rome. Americans should know that many hotels do not have bathtubs and a shower stall may not be the best option for you. (In the four hotels we stayed in throughout Italy, only one had a tub). If you are a large person, this will be something to investigate before booking any room.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: MistymooBrisbane
Reviews.Content: we could not have chosen a nicer place to stay in rome for the comfort,safety and service that this inn gave us,the room was large,beautifully furnished,spotlessly clean,everything was in perfect working order,the bed was huge and very comfortable,room service daily with fresh linen,the tv was huge and the lighting in the room excellent for reading. We had no trouble finding it as it is right across the road from the opera house and the number is clearly marked on the door We can not speak highly enough of the manager Emiliano,he speaks perfect english and helps you in every way possible,he is a credit to his profession. The room had no traffic noise at all and we couldn't believe how well we slept,the security in the inn is excellent,the location perfect and the price very reasonable,we would highly recommend this inn to anyone visiting Rome

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Luv-to-vacation_77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my husband in August. We originally got room 501 - and thankfully got moved to the third floor. Reason being, that this room was so small, that the shower stall is in the main bedroom. We thought that was a bit odd...Due to air conditioning issues we got moved to the 3rd floor, and these rooms were much better, and spacious, and the shower was in the right place...in the bathroom! The location is very good - near the train station and within walking distance of the major sites...The only thing that was slightly annoying is that there is a mini bar outside of the rooms, and as such, it can be very noisy in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: W1LDCARD
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel months in advance of my trip to Rome and at the time had only value in mind. It was a pleasant surprise therefore to find the hotel room small but very clean and cosy. We had a corner room with two large windows that opened fully, one with a spectacular view of the Opera House. On some nights the Opera House was rather busy, but close the windows and the room was once again very quiet. The staff were exceedingly friendly and eager to help. The guy behind the desk was quick to recommend sights and tours that we would be interested in and was happy to book them for us. When, on check in we received a coupon for a free pizza at a local restaurant I expected it to be a ‘only this one’ kind of thing but we were able to pick any pizza off the regular menu, and it was large, and delicious. In fact, every restaurant we tried within walking distance of the hotel was amazing and one in particular, I cant remember the name of it but it had a suit of armour out front and is on the way to the one mentioned before, was the best Italian food I have ever had bar none. Speaking of location it is only a short walk to the train station, only a slightly longer walk to the Coliseum, and the tour busses pick you up at the door. I required high speed internet access and got 24 hours for 10 Euro. I expected this to be in a block but was happy to find it worked on a login basis and that lasted the entire week of my stay. I highly recommend this hotel as I’m sure it is the best you will find for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! So much better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: DRital
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn just one night after our cruise. We were looking for a nice place with a reasonable rate that was convenient to the Termini. This place met the bill in all ways. It was a very easy walk, about one block from the end of the Termini bus lot. Keep in mind there is no big sign, just a small sign with the street number and name. But you can't miss it if you look at the Opera House and turn around. You are there. Don't get scared when you open the door. My wife immediately started getting upset saying, "What did you get us into?" We found the small one room lobby and quickly checked in. He clearly explained how the electronic key worked the front door, the entrance to the suite of rooms, and the door to our room. We entered through the first door and found a bright, clean, and modern space with a pot for hot water and a couple of doors to the individual rooms. Then we entered our room and were amazed. It was exactly as the photo showed on the website. It was not hugh. But then again, the price was not hugh and we were in Rome. It was an order of magnitude better than the so-called M.... Palace where we stayed last year. The full size bed had plenty of room to walk around and was very comfortable. There was a wide screen, flat panel TV and DVD player, a small refrigerator, and a nice painted mural on the wall over the bed. The window looked right out towards the Opera House. The bathroom was completed redone with tile and modern fixtures including the Jacuzzi shower. It was a little small but had multiple horizontal jets, a rain shower head, and a hand held shower. Very nice. On leaving my wife even said she would like to stay there again. The only potential negative comments I could say were the small sign and poor initial impression when you walk in the building. Guess that helped with the better impression once we got to the rooms. Lastly, the attendant was very helpful and informative in all cases but one. He couldn't tell us how to make an outside phone call. We had problems with lost luggage and were trying to contact the airlines. He said we couldn't call from the hotel and told us to go to the corner internet cafe. They said they couldn't dial an 800 number. Overall, it was a great place, in a great location, at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: roman158
Reviews.Content: Wow! what a great value for money! we booked early wich saved us allot of cash. Hotel is a little hard to find with no big signs next to the road or on the hotel itself. Just a 5/10 minute walk away from the main train station. Very comfortable (not so big) room with a superb jacuzzi shower with different light colors to choose from, big flatscreen tv, located perfect for all the tourist must see things in Rome. No 24h check in (had to pay the man at the front desk 10 euros or something like that for check in after 20:00 or 21:00 o'clock. They also rent dvd movies at the reception as a little extra service. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...No Perfect Base for a City Break in Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: DubinLass
Reviews.Content: We ABSOLUTELY LOVED this hotel!! We got a great price for the Al Viminale and as it was our first trip to Rome, we were a little worried that we may have been too cheap with our choice....we really had nothing to be worried about!! The hotel was fantastic! The location is excellent, only about a 5minute walk from Termini train station, which is so handy and also cheap as taxis in Rome can be quite expensive. I have read from many other reviews on Trip advisor that people have found it difficult to find the Hotel, I would advise you to look out for the Opera house as the door to the hotel is the large Brown Doors directly across the road from the main door into the Opera House. We also loved the fact that you could walk to pretty much every major tourist attraction from the hotel. The Colosseum, Roman Forum and Palatine Hill are 10 minutes away, and you can reach the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon etc on foot (takes a bit longer but it's lovely to ramble around the Roman streets)! The Hotel reception is only open from 8am-6pm, which suited us fine as we found that when in Rome, you spend very little time actually in the Hotel!! The staff were fantastic! Extremely friendly, efficient and helpful. During check in the lovely gentleman provided us with loads of information about our location and info about what buses and the Metro. When we were departing they stored our luggage for us for a few hours as our flight was not until the evening, and they did not charge us for this...which is very rare these days! We stayed in room 309 and it was FANTASTIC!!! The rooms appear to have been recently refurbished, excellent comfy beds, great bed linen, Flat screen TV, soundproof windows, Blackout Curtains...My favourite part though had to be the AMAZING bathroom...complete with modern dual his&hers sinks, inbuilt TV in the bathroom mirror and Jacuzzi shower with excellent strong water pressure!! There is no restaurant in this hotel, however we found this to be a plus as there are some gorgeous restaurants and coffee shops located right beside the hotel. We found the perfect traditional Italian coffee shop (I swear we were the only non-Italians in the place!!)that we went to every morning for the most delicious cappuccinos and Paninis and Pizzettes. I can't remember the name of the place but when you exit the hotel turn left and then another left at the next turn...across the road from 'That's Amore' Restaurant. I would not recommend the hotel for families due to the basic facilities. However we really cannot fault the hotel and highly recommend it to any couples or solo travellers looking for the perfect base for an affordable trip to Rome. We will DEFINITELY be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice rooms & facilities”
Reviews.Author: CosmicKidNZ
Reviews.Content: This place is a bit different but we were happy with it. It is about 10 minute walk from Termini station. Better to walk - we enquired with taxi drivers how much it would cost and they were saying about 20-25 euro which is a rip-off. The walk is easier if you walk through the station itself which we worked out when we went back to the station to leave Rome. The set-up at the hotel is a bit different. There is no 'hotel' sign out front just the name on the business listing at nbr 38. You check in downstairs and the reception lady is very helpful and friendly. Then they take you up in the quaint old lift to their floor with their hotel rooms and you can only get to this area with a swipe card so good security. Just outside the rooms is free tea and coffee facilities. The rooms have their own A/C, big screen tv (you can hire DVDs from reception too) and a jet shower. The shower is in the middle of the room so there is no privacy if that is an issue. Less than 5 min walk to Republica Metro station which I would suggest using for Metro rather than Termini which can be a bit of a suspect area at night. We walked to Colosseum from the hotel - an easy 10 min walk. So hotel had good location for trains & sights. Maybe a little pricey but the rooms were nice and it was quiet, safe and secure in good spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, but don't leave anything behind when you leave!”
Reviews.Author: madmacnz1
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights here. It was in a convenient but also relatively quiet location. Staff were friendly and reasonably helpful. There is a supermarket and an internet cafe across the road. We stayed on the 3rd floor (from memory! maybe higher) and had a lovely view out to the street and opera house across the road. The room was clean and nicely furnished, with good space for luggage. The bathroom was well appointed but the shower didn't live up to the advertising - very slow to get warm water, and water pressure was nowhere near what you'd need for such a fancy massage shower. We had a chiller in our room. The bed was comfortable and furnishings quite luxurious. There was an old-fashioned wire lift to our floor. Everything was closed up after hours and in the weekends, so I'd recommend arriving during business hours, although arrangements were made for guests outside these hours. We were very happy with our room until we'd been gone for a day and I realised I'd left behind a bag of shoes (1 pair of shoes plus 2 pairs of sandals). I phoned and emailed to ask if these had been picked up, and eventually found out that the cleaner had supposedly found them, thought they were rubbish, and thrown them in the rubbish skip! I find this hard to believe and wonder if he had helped himself to them... The shoes were in good condition and I would have thought they'd be handed in and kept for a week or so in case of inquiry. It was my own fault that I left them behind, but I now have a sour taste in my mouth about this one thing. Nevertheless, I would recommend this hotel to others. It was very close to Termini and several cafes and seemed reasonably priced compared to other hotels I had considered.

Reviews.Title: “Just what was needed”
Reviews.Author: SEASIDEJOHN
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, great location. We checked in before the 2pm it said and was greeted by a really helpful chap who showed us where everything in Rome was and how to get about. The bedroom although not huge was big enough for a queen size bed and had room for clothes etc, the shower was superb and after a long day walking everywhere 30 mins or so in the power shower you were fully recovered. The hotel is 5 mins walk to the station although we didn't use it as we walked everywhere, your 10 mins walk to the Colluseum and only 20 mins to the Spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: pkpenny
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 4 night stay in Rome. The Al Viminale was a great location to stay in - only a 5 min walk to Republica Metro station and 5 mins in the opposite direction to Termini station which covers both of Rome's underground lines and the tour bus terminus. The room was spotlessly clean, had a great jacuzzi shower , 40 inch flat screen TV and aircon (essential in the heat). It states B&B but no breakfast is included, tea / coffee facilities are available in a communal lobby area outside your door - however rooms have fridges for your use. Restaurants for breakfast are only 50 yards away. The area around the Opera house opposite was bustling but not noisy, the rooms are well soundproofed but if you want to catch the atmosphere on an Opera night just open your windows and soak it in. A tip if you are travelling into Ciampino airport - a taxi will set you back 60 euro one way - the Terravision bus service which is right outside the terminal and goes straight into Termini cost us 4 euro one way - it takes 40 mins, about 10 mins longer than a cab would. Al Viminale is then easily walkable but if you are feeling tired get one of the numerous taxis there for a few euros and save yourself some cash.

HotelInfo.Name: Al Viminale Hill Inn & Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Viminale 38, 00184 Rome, Italy
